author: stan_walker_md
post: “Rarity again does not help us much.” So true. But best to look at the whole rather than the sum of the parts. Let’s recall Spinoza’s saying, “All things excellent are as difficult as they are rare.” Excellant and and difficult and rare the shroud is. The quality of the cloth adds to the mystique of the shroud. Certainly worthy of burial cloth of the Christ!.
title: Is that another example of medieval herringbone linen?
